item.title: Threads and Processes
item.description: When you click on the Adobe Photoshop app, you start a process which is used to run the application. That process starts multiple threads to excute a lot of small tasks like loading plugins and fonts, building cache, etc. As threads can do anything that a process can do, a thread could be considered as a ‘lightweight’ process.

item.title: Threads in C++
item.description:
Let’s write a simple c++ program that can read and print a novel. But are we even an engineer if we don’t complicate this simple problem by introducing threads?
So let the program create multiple threads, such that each thread reads and prints just one word from the novel.

The challenge would be to ensure that the threads share the same data, don’t lock each other, and are scheduled in the right order.
